data.title: EastEnders betrayal as Phil Mitchell discovers truth about George's missing wife
data.meta_description: EastEnders' Linda Carter and Phil Mitchell will team up in a bid to find out the truth about George Knight's missing ex-wife Rose
data.text:
George Knight will continue to try and prove himself to his suspicious neighbours next week in EastEnders as he desperately fights to keep the true identity of his ex-wife secret.

Linda Carter (Kellie Bright) refuses to accept George (Colin Salmon) has nothing to hide and enlists Phil Mitchell (Steve McFadden) to find out more about ex-wife Rose's disappearance.

Phil eventually agrees, wanting to make sure he can trust the man he's about to go into business with and persuades Callum Highway ( Tony Clay ) to search the police database to ease Linda's concerns.

Callum's search of George proves he has a relatively clean record but alarmingly he's unable to search the database for Rose as all access is denied.

When Linda hears this she decides her concerns have been proved right while Phil invites George to the Boxing Den to ask him directly about Rose.

The former champion boxer insists he isn't hiding anything and Linda's vendetta has to stop.

Later in the week, Phil is stalling to sign with George and asks his lawyer Richie to dig up dirt on Rose.

When George arrives at The Vic believing he's set to sign the contracts for his new business deal, Phil accuses him of not being straight with him.

Meanwhile, EastEnders actor Colin has revealed George is increasingly losing his patience with Linda and Phil thinking the worse of him.

Speaking out on Phil confronting him, the actor said: "George is affronted and angry. It's about respect, and George finds it disrespectful, and that makes him cross. He's like, 'Hang on a minute, you don't know the story, so you've jumped to the wrong conclusion.'

"But again, George does understand how Phil got to that conclusion, and Linda isn't helping. George has been living under a cloud. Some people think he killed Rose, so it's been nine years of mystery and heartache on top of suspicion and misunderstanding. It's hard if you are a member of a family and your spouse has gone missing, everyone thinks they know what's going on."

EastEnders airs on BBC One from Monday to Thursday at 7.30pm.

Got any theories or thoughts on the storyline? Let us know in the comments section below.
